headers.mt1: The Fourth Book of Moses, called Numbers

verses.text:
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses in the wilderness of
Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first \add day\add*
of the second month, in the second year after they were come out
of the land of Egypt, saying,

From twenty years old and upward, all that are able to go forth
to war in Israel: thou and Aaron shall number them by their armies.

And with you there shall be a man of every tribe; every one
head of the house of his fathers.

¶ And these \add are\add* the names of the men that shall stand with you: of
\add the tribe of\add* Reuben; Elizur the son of Shedeur.
Of Simeon; Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
Of Judah; Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
Of Issachar; Nethaneel the son of Zuar.
Of Zebulun; Eliab the son of Helon.

Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim; Elishama the son of
Ammihud: of Manasseh; Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
Of Benjamin; Abidan the son of Gideoni.
Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
Of Asher; Pagiel the son of Ocran.

Of Gad; Eliasaph the son of Deuel.\f + \fr 1.14  \ft Deuel: also called,
Reuel\f*
Of Naphtali; Ahira the son of Enan.

These \add  were\add* the renowned of the congregation, princes
of the tribes of their fathers, heads of thousands in Israel.

¶ And Moses and Aaron took these men which are expressed by
\add their\add* names:

And they assembled all the congregation together on the first
\add day\add* of the second month, and they declared their pedigrees
after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the
number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their polls.

As the \nd LORD\nd* commanded  Moses, so he numbered them in the
wilderness of Sinai.

And the children of Reuben, Israel’s eldest son, by their
generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers,
according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male
from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth
to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Reuben, \add were\add* forty and six thousand and five hundred.

¶ Of the children of Simeon, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, those that were numbered
of them, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every
male from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth
to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Simeon, \add were\add* fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.

¶ Of the children of Gad, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Gad, \add were\add* forty and five thousand six hundred and fifty.

¶ Of the children of Judah, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Judah, \add were\add* threescore and fourteen thousand and six
hundred.

¶ Of the children of Issachar, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Issachar, \add were\add* fifty and four thousand and four hundred.

¶ Of the children of Zebulun, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Zebulun, \add were\add* fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.

¶ Of the children of Joseph, \add namely\add*, of the children
of Ephraim, by their generations, after their families, by the house
of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty
years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Ephraim, \add were\add* forty thousand and five hundred.

¶ Of the children of Manasseh, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Manasseh, \add were\add* thirty and two thousand and two hundred.

¶ Of the children of Benjamin, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Benjamin, \add were\add* thirty and five thousand and four hundred.

¶ Of the children of Dan, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Dan, \add were\add* threescore and two thousand and seven hundred.

¶ Of the children of Asher, by their generations, after their
families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Asher, \add were\add* forty and one thousand and five hundred.

¶ Of the children of Naphtali, throughout their generations,
after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the
number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go
forth to war;

Those that were numbered of them, \add even\add* of the tribe
of Naphtali, \add were\add* fifty and three thousand and four hundred.

These \add are\add* those that were numbered, which Moses and
Aaron numbered, and the princes of Israel, \add being\add* twelve
men: each one was for the house of his fathers.

Even all they that were numbered were six hundred thousand
and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.

¶ But the Levites after the tribe of their fathers were not
numbered among them.

Only thou shalt not number the tribe of Levi, neither take
the sum of them among the children of Israel:

But thou shalt appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of
testimony, and over all the vessels thereof, and over all things that
\add belong\add* to it: they shall bear the tabernacle, and all the
vessels thereof; and they shall minister unto it, and shall encamp
round about the tabernacle.

And when the tabernacle setteth forward, the Levites shall take it
down: and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it
up: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

And the children of Israel shall pitch their tents, every
man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, throughout their
hosts.

But the Levites shall pitch round about the tabernacle of
testimony, that there be no wrath upon the congregation of the children
of Israel: and the Levites shall keep the charge of the tabernacle
of testimony.

And the children of Israel did according to all that the \nd LORD\nd*
commanded Moses, so did they.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

Every man of the children of Israel shall pitch by his own
standard, with the ensign of their father’s house: far off about
the tabernacle of the congregation shall they pitch.\f + \fr 2.2 
\ft far…: Heb. over against\f*

And on the east side toward the rising of the sun shall they of the
standard of the camp of Judah pitch throughout their armies: and
Nahshon the son of Amminadab \add shall be\add* captain of the children
of Judah.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
threescore and fourteen thousand and six hundred.

And those that do pitch next unto him \add shall be\add* the
tribe of Issachar: and Nethaneel the son of Zuar \add shall be\add*
captain of the children of Issachar.

And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, \add were\add*
fifty and four thousand and four hundred.

\add Then\add* the tribe of Zebulun: and Eliab the son of Helon
\add shall be\add* captain of the children of Zebulun.

And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, \add were\add*
fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.

All that were numbered in the camp of Judah \add were\add*
an hundred thousand and fourscore thousand and six thousand and four
hundred, throughout their armies. These shall first set forth.

¶ On the south side \add shall be\add* the standard of the
camp of Reuben according to their armies: and the captain of the
children of Reuben \add shall be\add* Elizur the son of Shedeur.

And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, \add were\add*
forty and six thousand and five hundred.

And those which pitch by him \add shall be\add* the tribe
of Simeon: and the captain of the children of Simeon \add shall be\add*
Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.

Then the tribe of Gad: and the captain of the sons of Gad
\add shall be\add* Eliasaph the son of Reuel.\f + \fr 2.14  \ft Reuel: also called,
Deuel\f*

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
forty and five thousand and six hundred and fifty.

All that were numbered in the camp of Reuben \add were\add*
an hundred thousand and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and
fifty, throughout their armies. And they shall set forth in the second
rank.

¶ Then the tabernacle of the congregation shall set forward
with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camp: as they encamp,
so shall they set forward, every man in his place by their standards.

¶ On the west side \add shall be\add* the standard of the camp
of Ephraim according to their armies: and the captain of the sons
of Ephraim \add shall be\add* Elishama the son of Ammihud.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
forty thousand and five hundred.

And by him \add shall be\add* the tribe of Manasseh: and the
captain of the children of Manasseh \add shall be\add* Gamaliel the
son of Pedahzur.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
thirty and two thousand and two hundred.

Then the tribe of Benjamin: and the captain of the sons of
Benjamin \add shall be\add* Abidan the son of Gideoni.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
thirty and five thousand and four hundred.

All that were numbered of the camp of Ephraim \add were\add*
an hundred thousand and eight thousand and an hundred, throughout their
armies. And they shall go forward in the third rank.

¶ The standard of the camp of Dan \add shall be\add* on the north
side by their armies: and the captain of the children of Dan \add shall
be\add* Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
threescore and two thousand and seven hundred.

And those that encamp by him \add shall be\add* the tribe
of Asher: and the captain of the children of Asher \add shall be\add*
Pagiel the son of Ocran.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
forty and one thousand and five hundred.

¶ Then the tribe of Naphtali: and the captain of the children
of Naphtali \add shall be\add* Ahira the son of Enan.

And his host, and those that were numbered of them, \add were\add*
fifty and three thousand and four hundred.

All they that were numbered in the camp of Dan \add were\add*
an hundred thousand and fifty and seven thousand and six hundred.
They shall go hindmost with their standards.

¶ These \add are\add* those which were numbered of the children
of Israel by the house of their fathers: all those that were numbered
of the camps throughout their hosts \add were\add* six hundred thousand
and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.

But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel;
as the \nd LORD\nd* commanded Moses.

And the children of Israel did according to all that the \nd LORD\nd*
commanded Moses: so they pitched by their standards, and so they set
forward, every one after their families, according to the house of their
fathers.

These also \add are\add* the generations of Aaron and Moses
in the day \add that\add* the \nd LORD\nd* spake with Moses in mount
Sinai.

And these \add are\add* the names of the sons of Aaron; Nadab
the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

These \add are\add* the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests
which were anointed, whom he consecrated to minister in the priest’s
office.\f + \fr 3.3  \ft whom…: Heb. whose hand he filled\f*

And Nadab and Abihu died before the \nd LORD\nd*, when they
offered strange fire before the \nd LORD\nd*, in the wilderness of
Sinai, and they had no children: and Eleazar and Ithamar ministered in the priest’s
office in the sight of Aaron their father.
¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron
the priest, that they may minister unto him.

And they shall keep his charge, and the charge of the whole
congregation before the tabernacle of the congregation, to do the
service of the tabernacle.

And they shall keep all the instruments of the tabernacle of the
congregation, and the charge of the children of Israel, to do the
service of the tabernacle.

And thou shalt give the Levites unto Aaron and to his sons: they
\add are\add* wholly given unto him out of the children of Israel.

And thou shalt appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall wait
on their priest’s office: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to
death.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

Because all the firstborn \add are\add* mine; \add for\add*
on the day that I smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I
hallowed unto me all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast: mine shall they be: I
\add am\add* the \nd LORD\nd*.

¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses in the wilderness
of Sinai, saying,

Number the children of Levi after the house of their fathers,
by their families: every male from a month old and upward shalt thou
number them.

And Moses numbered them according to the word of the \nd LORD\nd*,
as he was commanded.\f + \fr 3.16  \ft word: Heb. mouth\f*

And these were the sons of Levi by their names; Gershon, and
Kohath, and Merari.

And these \add are\add* the names of the sons of Gershon by their
families; Libni, and Shimei.

And the sons of Kohath by their families; Amram, and Izehar,
Hebron, and Uzziel.

And the sons of Merari by their families; Mahli, and Mushi. These
\add  are\add* the families of the Levites according to the house
of their fathers.

Of Gershon \add was\add* the family of the Libnites, and the
family of the Shimites: these \add are\add* the families of the Gershonites.

Those that were numbered of them, according to the number
of all the males, from a month old and upward, \add even\add* those that were
numbered of them \add were\add* seven thousand and five hundred.

The families of the Gershonites shall pitch behind the tabernacle
westward.

And the chief of the house of the father of the Gershonites
\add shall be\add* Eliasaph the son of Lael.

And the charge of the sons of Gershon in the tabernacle of the
congregation \add shall be\add* the tabernacle, and the tent, the
covering thereof, and the hanging for the door of the tabernacle
of the congregation,

And the hangings of the court, and the curtain for the door
of the court, which \add is\add* by the tabernacle, and by the altar
round about, and the cords of it for all the service thereof.

¶ And of Kohath \add was\add* the family of the Amramites,
and the family of the Izeharites, and the family of the Hebronites,
and the family of the Uzzielites: these \add are\add* the families
of the Kohathites.

In the number of all the males, from a month old and upward,
\add were\add* eight thousand and six hundred, keeping the charge
of the sanctuary.

The families of the sons of Kohath shall pitch on the side
of the tabernacle southward.

And the chief of the house of the father of the families of the
Kohathites \add shall be\add* Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.

And their charge \add shall be\add* the ark, and the table,
and the candlestick, and the altars, and the vessels of the sanctuary
wherewith they minister, and the hanging, and all the service thereof.

And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest \add shall be\add*
chief over the chief of the Levites, \add and have\add* the oversight
of them that keep the charge of the sanctuary.

¶ Of Merari \add was\add* the family of the Mahlites, and the
family of the Mushites: these \add are\add* the families of Merari.

And those that were numbered of them, according to the number
of all the males, from a month old and upward, \add were\add* six
thousand and two hundred.

And the chief of the house of the father of the families of
Merari \add was\add* Zuriel the son of Abihail: \add these\add* shall
pitch on the side of the tabernacle northward.

And \add under\add* the custody and charge of the sons of Merari
\add shall be\add* the boards of the tabernacle, and the bars thereof, and the
pillars thereof, and the sockets thereof, and all the vessels thereof, and all that
serveth thereto,\f + \fr 3.36  \ft under…: Heb. the office of the
charge\f*

And the pillars of the court round about, and their sockets,
and their pins, and their cords.

¶ But those that encamp before the tabernacle toward the east,
\add even\add* before the tabernacle of the congregation eastward,
\add shall be\add* Moses, and Aaron and his sons, keeping the charge
of the sanctuary for the charge of the children of Israel; and the
stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

All that were numbered of the Levites, which Moses and Aaron
numbered at the commandment of the \nd LORD\nd*, throughout their
families, all the males from a month old and upward, \add were\add*
twenty and two thousand.

¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto Moses, Number all the firstborn
of the males of the children of Israel from a month old and upward,
and take the number of their names.

And thou shalt take the Levites for me (I \add am\add* the
\nd LORD\nd*) instead of all the firstborn among the children of
Israel; and the cattle of the Levites instead of all the firstlings
among the cattle of the children of Israel.

And Moses numbered, as the \nd LORD\nd* commanded him, all the
firstborn among the children of Israel.

And all the firstborn males by the number of names, from a
month old and upward, of those that were numbered of them, were twenty
and two thousand two hundred and threescore and thirteen.

Thou shalt even take five shekels apiece by the poll, after the
shekel of the sanctuary shalt thou take \add them:\add* (the shekel
\add is\add* twenty gerahs:)

And thou shalt give the money, wherewith the odd number of them is to be
redeemed, unto Aaron and to his sons.

And Moses took the redemption money of them that were over
and above them that were redeemed by the Levites:

And Moses gave the money of them that were redeemed unto Aaron
and to his sons, according to the word of the 
d LORD
d*, as the

d LORD
d* commanded Moses.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi,
after their families, by the house of their fathers,

From thirty years old and upward even until fifty years old,
all that enter into the host, to do the work in the tabernacle of the
congregation.

This \add shall be\add* the service of the sons of Kohath in the
tabernacle of the congregation, \add about\add* the most holy things:

¶ And when the camp setteth forward, Aaron shall come, and his
sons, and they shall take down the covering vail, and cover the ark
of testimony with it:

And shall put thereon the covering of badgers’ skins, and shall
spread over \add it\add* a cloth wholly of blue, and shall put in the
staves thereof.

And upon the table of shewbread they shall spread a cloth of
blue, and put thereon the dishes, and the spoons, and the bowls,
and covers to cover withal: and the continual bread shall be thereon:\f + \fr 4.7 
\ft cover…: or, pour out withal\f*

And they shall spread upon them a cloth of scarlet, and cover
the same with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put in the
staves thereof.

And they shall take a cloth of blue, and cover the candlestick
of the light, and his lamps, and his tongs, and his snuffdishes,
and all the oil vessels thereof, wherewith they minister unto it:

And they shall put it and all the vessels thereof within a
covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put \add it\add* upon a bar.

And upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue,
and cover it with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put to the
staves thereof:

And they shall take all the instruments of ministry, wherewith they
minister in the sanctuary, and put \add them\add* in a cloth of blue,
and cover them with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put \add them\add*
on a bar:

And they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread
a purple cloth thereon:

And they shall put upon it all the vessels thereof, wherewith they
minister about it, \add even\add* the censers, the fleshhooks, and the
shovels, and the basons, all the vessels of the altar; and they shall
spread upon it a covering of badgers’ skins, and put to the staves of
it.\f + \fr 4.14  \ft basons: or, bowls\f*

And when Aaron and his sons have made an end of covering the
sanctuary, and all the vessels of the sanctuary, as the camp is to set
forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to bear \add it:\add*
but they shall not touch \add any\add* holy thing, lest they die. These
\add things are\add* the burden of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle
of the congregation.

¶ And to the office of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest
\add pertaineth\add* the oil for the light, and the sweet incense,
and the daily meat offering, and the anointing oil, \add and\add*
the oversight of all the tabernacle, and of all that therein \add is\add*,
in the sanctuary, and in the vessels thereof.
¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

Cut ye not off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites
from among the Levites:

But thus do unto them, that they may live, and not die, when they
approach unto the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in,
and appoint them every one to his service and to his burden:

But they shall not go in to see when the holy things are covered,
lest they die.
¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* spake  unto Moses, saying,

Take also the sum of the sons of Gershon, throughout the houses
of their fathers, by their families;

From thirty years old and upward until fifty years old shalt thou
number them; all that enter in to perform the service, to do the
work in the tabernacle of the congregation.\f + \fr 4.23  \ft to perform…: Heb. to war the
warfare\f*

This \add is\add* the service of the families of the Gershonites,
to serve, and for burdens:\f + \fr 4.24  \ft burdens: or, carriage\f*

And they shall bear the curtains of the tabernacle, and the
tabernacle of the congregation, his covering, and the covering of the
badgers’ skins that \add is\add* above upon it, and the hanging for the
door of the tabernacle of the congregation,

And the hangings of the court, and the hanging for the door
of the gate of the court, which \add is\add* by the tabernacle and by the
altar round about, and their cords, and all the instruments of their
service, and all that is made for them: so shall they serve.

At the appointment of Aaron and his sons shall be all the
service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their burdens, and in all their
service: and ye shall appoint unto them in charge all their burdens.\f + \fr 4.27 
\ft appointment: Heb. mouth\f*

This \add is\add* the service of the families of the sons of
Gershon in the tabernacle of the congregation: and their charge \add shall
be\add* under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

¶ As for the sons of Merari, thou shalt number them after their
families, by the house of their fathers;

From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old
shalt thou number them, every one that entereth into the service,
to do the work of the tabernacle of the congregation.\f + \fr 4.30 
\ft service: Heb. warfare\f*

And this \add is\add* the charge of their burden, according to all their
service in the tabernacle of the congregation; the boards of the
tabernacle, and the bars thereof, and the pillars thereof, and sockets thereof,

And the pillars of the court round about, and their sockets,
and their pins, and their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their
service: and by name ye shall reckon the instruments of the charge
of their burden.

This \add is\add* the service of the families of the sons of
Merari, according to all their service, in the tabernacle of the
congregation, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

¶ And Moses and Aaron and the chief of the congregation numbered
the sons of the Kohathites after their families, and after the house
of their fathers,

From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old,
every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle
of the congregation:

And those that were numbered of them by their families were two
thousand seven hundred and fifty.

These \add were\add* they that were numbered of the families
of the Kohathites, all that might do service in the tabernacle of the
congregation, which Moses and Aaron did number according to the commandment
of the \nd LORD\nd* by the hand of Moses.

And those that were numbered of the sons of Gershon, throughout their
families, and by the house of their fathers,

From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old,
every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle
of the congregation,

Even those that were numbered of them, throughout their families,
by the house of their fathers, were two thousand and six hundred
and thirty.

These \add are\add* they that were numbered of the families
of the sons of Gershon, of all that might do service in the tabernacle
of the congregation, whom Moses and Aaron did number according to the
commandment of the \nd LORD\nd*.

¶ And those that were numbered of the families of the sons
of Merari, throughout their families, by the house of their fathers,

From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old,
every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle
of the congregation,

Even those that were numbered of them after their families,
were three thousand and two hundred.

These \add be\add* those that were numbered of the families
of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the
word of the \nd LORD\nd* by the hand of Moses.

All those that were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and
Aaron and the chief of Israel numbered, after their families, and after the
house of their fathers,

From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old,
every one that came to do the service of the ministry, and the service
of the burden in the tabernacle of the congregation,

Even those that were numbered of them, were eight thousand
and five hundred and fourscore.

According to the commandment of the \nd LORD\nd* they were
numbered by the hand of Moses, every one according to his service,
and according to his burden: thus were they numbered of him, as the
\nd LORD\nd* commanded Moses.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, saying,

Command the children of Israel, that they put out of the camp
every leper, and every one that hath an issue, and whosoever is defiled
by the dead:

Both male and female shall ye put out, without the camp shall ye
put them; that they defile not their camps, in the midst whereof
I dwell.

And the children of Israel did so, and put them out without
the camp: as the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto Moses, so did the children
of Israel.
